results.title: The Early years
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Bristol Education Authority, Eileen Molony and George Inger
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Springs of learning”.
The importance of the early years of childhood is discussed by Dr. K. Lovell of the Institute of Education, University of Leeds, Dr. C.B. Hindley of the Centre for Study of Human Development, University of London, and Dr. W.A. Marshall of the Institute of Child Health, University of London.

results.title: The Early Renaissance of Italy
results.creator_credit: WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.), Channel Four and Mick Gold
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Art of the western world”.
Covers the revival and reinterpretation of the classical tradition in the works of Florentine artists Masaccio, Donatello, and Ghiberti. Discusses how these artists exemplify the merging of Christian and humanistic values. Examines the realism of Jan van Eyck and the spiritual crisis of Northern Europe as revealed in Gruenwald’s Isenheim altarpiece. Discusses the spirit of the Renaissance as reflected in Durer’s work.

results.title: The early films of Hans Richter = Ghosts before breakfast
results.brief_description: This surrealist experimental film was made in 1927 by artist-painter Hans Richter. The nazis destroyed the sound version of this film and classified it as “degenerate art”. The film shows everyday objects rebelling against their daily routine.
results.title_for_label: The early films of Hans Richter = Ghosts before breakfast

results.title: The Eagle has landed [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: ITC Entertainment, Jack Wiener, David Niven Jr and John Sturges
results.brief_description: A Colonel with the Luftwaffe, imprisoned for striking a fellow officer, is offered a lifeline when Nazi Colonel Radl (Robert Duvall) asks him to lead a daring suicide mission to kidnap Winston Churchill. Radl has received direct orders from Heinrich Himmler (Donald Pleasance), who in turn, has been instructed by Hitler himself. The PM is known to be holidaying in Norfolk, so recently released prisoner Karl Steiner (Michael Caine) and his men parachute into Sudley Constable, a small village nearby, camouflaged as Polish allies. The sixteen man team comprises of a motley crew of stereotypes, including a honey voiced IRA man Liam Devlin (Donald Sutherland), who dupes a young girl on horseback (Jenny Agutter) - one of the few women in the film. After an incident in which one of his men saves the life of a local boy, their mission is jeopardised when the rescuer is killed and his Nazi identity revealed beneath the Polish garb. Steiner and his men take refuge in a Church as they await the arrival of Churchill to complete the Fuhrer’s orders. Based on the Jack Higgins novel, this was the last film John Sturges (The Great escape, The Magnificent seven) directed before his death in 1992. Cast also includes Anthony Quayle, Jean Marsh, Treat Williams and Larry Hagman. Screenplay by Tom Mankiewicz.

results.title: The Eagle's track
results.creator_credit: Film Polski, W Wiesidlek and S. Sprudin
results.brief_description: The High Tatra Mountains have become the climbing and ski ground of Poland. This film takes us with a party which follows the arduous “Eagle’s Track” to one of the highest peaks. The film describes and captures the excitement of mountaineering and shows, incidentally, the equipment and methods used for climbing rock, ice and snow.

results.title: The Dynamic atmosphere
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, S.T. Evans and Roger Seccombe
results.brief_description: This film shows how the technicians and scientists of CSIRO measures aspects of the atmosphere. This includes experiments on “rotational” effects and their relevance to climatic disturbances. It shows the influence of cloud types on solar and infra-red radiation streams, and features an explanation of the ozone layer. Narrated by Keith Livingstone.

results.title: The Duties of a secretary
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the duties of a secretary and shows how they should be carried out to ensure maximum efficiency in the office. Shows correct and incorrect methods of handling a job, the wrong methods being demonstrated in a dream which a young secretary experiences on the eve of beginning a new job.

results.title: The Dust bowl
results.creator_credit: CBS News, Burton Benjamin and Mel Stuart
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Contrasts past and present conditions of the Dust Bowl area of the Southern Great Plains. Provides newsreel footage of the area during the dust storms period of the early 1930s. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Durango Daredevil strikes again: bullying
results.brief_description: Shows the negative result of intimidation and the undesirability of such actions. Shows how Butch Bear dresses up like his hero, the Durango Daredevil, and terrorises his puppet friends because they won’t let him play piano in the school concert. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Dunera boys
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a group of Jewish men who after the outbreak of World War II, were rounded up in England and, in the face of there being suspicion about them, sent out to Australia on board the S.S. Dunera. In Australia they were interned in a camp at Hay, in New South Wales, a location which, with their sense of humour intact, the “boys” transformed into a parody of Vienese cafe society. Among their number were some of the most remarkable and individual characters to arrive on Australian shores and slowly but surely they broke down the barriers and established a bond of trust with the Australian authorities, a trust which eventually allowed the group to become part of the effort to defeat the threatening Fascist forces, and later, people of great distinction in post-war Australia.
